p: Both SDMs were replicated 100 times, and then averaged. Finally, to predict altitudinal distribution of E. californica in central Chile, we generated prediction for niche occupancy profiles [47] from the native and invaded ranges to the invaded range. This method integrates the occurrence probabilities for SDMs (raw data) over a climatic layer, generating a profile for habitat suitability across environmental gradient [47]; in this study we used altitudinal gradient.
